metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16233 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
drivers/scsi/qla2xxx/qla_os.c in the Linux kernel 5.2.14 does not check thealloc_workqueue return value, leading to a NULL pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1070.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1106.117
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1066.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1052.56
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1132-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1132.141
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1136.144
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-74.83~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1070.77').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.117').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1057.59~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1052.56').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.34~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.141').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.144').
